Answers.MP Summary: display information about the CPU architecture
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Display only information about offline CPUs in a table
Top-3 Similar Questions: tldr_5075: Display only information about offline CPUs in a table

Explanations about Options.--extended: Display the CPU information in human-readable format.
Explanations about Options.--offline:
Limit the output to offline CPUs. This option may only be specified together with
 option -e or -p.

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1235672: How to see the voltage in Conky?

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Mount all the filesystem defined in /etc/fstab
Top-3 Similar Questions: su_161932: I cannot see a new hard drive in Debian

Explanations about Options.-t:
The argument following the -t is used to indicate the filesystem type. The
 filesystem types which are currently supported depend on the running kernel. See
 /proc/filesystems and /lib/modules/$(uname -r)/kernel/fs for a complete list of the
 filesystems. The most common are ext2, ext3, ext4, xfs, btrfs, vfat, sysfs, proc,
 nfs and cifs.
